intro: Bartlettia scaposa, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, elongated stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Bartlettia scaposa typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
